column1: Alatyr (Russian: Ала́тырь; Chuvash: Улатăр Ulatăr) is a town in the Chuvash Republic
column3: located on the Sura River at its confluence with the Alatyr River. Population: 38

column1: Alatyr is one of the oldest towns in the republic. It was founded in 1552 as a fortified outpost where an old Mordvin village once stood
column2: and was granted town status in 1780. Alatyr gained economic importance in 1894 after to the construction of the Moscow—Ryazan—Kazan railroad.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Alatyr serves as the administrative center of Alatyrsky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column4: it is incorporated separately as the town of republic significance of Alatyr—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the town of republic significance of Alatyr is incorporated as Alatyr Urban Okrug.
